SETTINGS_ACCESS_CONTROL_FIELDS_DESCRIPTI: Allow guests to access specific hostnames or subnets whether or not they have authorized.
SETTINGS_ACCESS_CONTROL_FIELDS_ACTION_AD: Add IPv4 Hostname, IP or Subnet
SETTINGS_ACCESS_CONTROL_FIELDS_DESCRIPTI: Restrict guests from accessing specific hostnames or subnets after they have authorized.
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_AM_TITLE_1: Individual users or clients who are designated as VIP
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_AM_TITLE_2: Are excluded from any limitations and are given top priority over all other clients and users
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_HOTSPOT_TITLE_1: A WiFi Hotspot provides internet access to your wireless guests
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_HOTSPOT_TITLE_2: Guests can gain access to the WiFi Hotspot using various authentication methods
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_HOTSPOT_TITLE_3: Once connected, the guest cannot access any other part of your network
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_HOTSPOT_TITLE_4: And is only allowed access to the internet
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_HOTSPOT_TITLE_5: Internet access can be limited, controlled, and monitored
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_HOTSPOT_TITLE_6: To offer the best experience possible to all hotspot guests
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_NETWORKS_TITLE_1: A Defined or Virtual Network exists within your primary network
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_NETWORKS_TITLE_2: It is used to separate clients without physically connecting them to a different network
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_NETWORKS_TITLE_3: You can create as many Defined Networks as you wish
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_NETWORKS_TITLE_4: Using them to keep traffic organized
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_NETWORKS_TITLE_5: And improve the overall performance of your network
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_NETWORKS_TITLE_6: Defined Networks can have access to each other and the rest of your network
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_NETWORKS_TITLE_7: But they are generally kept segregated for improved network security
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_NETWORKS_TITLE_8: So if a client on a Defined Network becomes compromised
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_NETWORKS_TITLE_9: The threat is contained to that network and can be easily mitigated
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_SECURITY_TITLE_1: Your network is protected by the UniFi Threat Management
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_SECURITY_TITLE_2: Alerting you and acting on any known potential threats
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_SECURITY_TITLE_3: Threat Management stays up to date through automatic updates
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_SECURITY_TITLE_4: Staying on top of the constantly growing and evolving list of security threats
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_SECURITY_TITLE_5: Protecting your network from the latest known threats
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_UNIFI_TITLE_1: UniFi Network is the software that allows you to manage your network
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_UNIFI_TITLE_2: Enabling you to monitor and optimize your network elements
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_UNIFI_TITLE_3: Each network location uses the UniFi Network software to manage its elements
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_UNIFI_TITLE_4: Which can be accessed from your mobile device or computer
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_UNIFI_TITLE_5: UniFi Network allows you to easily define configurations for your network
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_UNIFI_TITLE_6: And quickly synchronize  settings across all network elements
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_VPN_TITLE_1: Connecting to a network typically requires being wired or within range of a wireless connection
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_VPN_TITLE_2: With a Virtual Private Network (VPN) you can leave the confines of your network
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_VPN_TITLE_3: And go anywhere in the world
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_VPN_TITLE_4: A VPN creates a tunnel between you and the network through the internet
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_VPN_TITLE_5: Where encrypted communication can be exchanged privately and securely
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_VPN_TITLE_6: So no matter where you are, as long as you have access to the internet
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_WIFI_TITLE_1: Your UniFi Access Point broadcasts your WiFi
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_WIFI_TITLE_2: Providing internet access to many devices
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_WIFI_TITLE_3: Providing internet access to many, many devices
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_WIFI_TITLE_4: A single AP can support hundreds of connected devices and cover up to 2,000 square feet, depending on the model
SETTINGS_ANIMATIONS_WIFI_TITLE_5: Multiple AP's act as one unified WiFi Network

Receive an alert when threats or malicious activity are detected on your network.

Enables identification of all known threats.

SETTINGS_WIFI_FORM_ADVANCED_DATA_RATE_CO: Enable minimum data rate control for {band}
Use the slider to determine what bitrates your network will allow.
Disabling lower bitrates can improve performance for higher-density networks but will make some older devices incompatible with your network, as well as limiting the range of your wireless network.
We do not recommend making changes to this setting for most users. To override our default configuration here, disable Auto-optimize Network in your Network settings.

SETTINGS_SYSTEM_CTRL_DISCOVERABLE_DESCRI: Make this UniFi OS Console discoverable on a Layer 2 network.
SETTINGS_SYSTEM_CTRL_LIVE_UPDATES_DESCRI: This option is available for debugging and tuning purposes. Frequent, real-time system updates may diminish web application performance if you have a large UniFi system. The UniFi Network application will adjust its update frequency based on the size of your UniFi system.
SETTINGS_SYSTEM_CTRL_LIVE_UPDATE_OPTION_: Automatically adapt rates of real-time updates
SETTINGS_SYSTEM_CTRL_ANALYTICS_DESCRIPTI: Enable Analytics & Improvements to help us improve product quality and user experience. When this option is enabled, we will collect device identifiers, such as IP addresses and MAC IDs. Ubiquiti respects your privacy and will only use such data in accordance with the Privacy Policy.
SETTINGS_SYSTEM_CTRL_ANALYTICS_TOOLTIP: Analytics & Improvements are enabled by default in Alpha and Early Access
SETTINGS_SYSTEM_CTRL_DESCRIPTION_GOOGLE_: A valid API key is required to use Google Maps locally. To learn how to obtain a key, please refer to Google's documentation. The key should be assigned to your UniFi OS Console's domain or IP address.
